primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a life distorted by worldly systems (greed, anxiety, power) to a 'faithful life' of alternative existence through the call of God and the example of Jesus.

tekstueel_bewijs: I believe that now the church must think afresh
the people called by God are to live a faithful life
we move... from command to call
what such a faithful life would look like
The commands were given by God
that the neighborhood might be reconstituted
that the world may come to know
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Subject (The one tasked with the mission)

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus will move you beyond yourself
helper.rol_van_god: Helper (Jesus provides the pattern/motivation for the Subject's action)

tegenstander.identificatie: The Distortion / Social System / Worldly Wisdom
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as a 'dysfunctional arrangement of social power' rather than an ontological or spiritual death that the Subject is powerless against.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Easter' narrative where God gives life to the weak.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program is the Church's mission; the secondary program (God's grace) is used as the fuel or 'boasting' point for the primary program.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will give what we need
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we must desist from the futile effort
we move... from command to call

voorbeelden: I want to think with you
the community... that intends to live
the wisdom of the world does not teach us
Jesus will move you beyond yourself
God will give what we need

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Devoir). It assumes that by 'imagining' and 'thinking afresh' (Savoir), the church can and must act (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Distortion) to ~S1 (Moralism) to S1 (The Alternative Call).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the Church's decision to 'depart' the distortion and 'embrace' the call.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a social pathology rather than a terminal spiritual condition.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it uses the language of 'Easter' and 'Gift,' the actantial structure places the Church as the Subject of the mission to subvert the world. God is the Sender/Caller, but the Church is the Hero.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: the church must think afresh what such a faithful life would look like
When we live in that way, we expose the way the world is organized

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Easter weakness that lets God’s new life surge upon us

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as the one who 'helps us see' and 'protests,' serving as the model for the church's own protest.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Instead of Jesus 'helping us see' how to protest, Jesus *is* the protest of God that has already overcome the world on our behalf.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration followed by the weight of an 'enormous call.'
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification (the alternative life) precedes or swallows Justification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically coherent but structurally shifts between God's gift and the Church's task without a clear causal link other than 'imagining.'
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God will give what we need' and 'the church must think afresh.'

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus... helps us see that the learnedness of the world will not save the world.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'call' itself is treated as the endowment of competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'distortion' and 'anxiety' rather than 'death' or 'enmity with God.'

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Recruitment' narrative. God is the Sender who issues a mandate, and the Church is the Subject who must execute the performance. Jesus is the Helper/Model.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The Church is the subject of 'subverting' and 'reconstituting.'
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the subject of the subversion.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: In the cross, God has already subverted the distortion, freeing us to simply walk in the light.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the hearer as the one who was 'distorted' and was 'rescued' by Jesus' temple-cleansing action.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Move from 'we must live alternatively' to 'the Spirit enables us to live alternatively.'

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: The 'Distortion' is a power we cannot think our way out of.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just a 'system,' we just need a better 'imagination.' If the opponent is Sin, we need a Savior.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (What Jesus did in the temple) must be the finished ground upon which the Call stands.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful social critique that risks becoming a new law. To move toward grace, ensure God remains the Subject of the active verbs of transformation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is brilliant and 'prophetic.' Actantially, it is a mandate-driven narrative.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis identifies the 'what' of the text; Greimas reveals that the 'who' of the action has shifted from God to the Church.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Easter' is used as a modal helper (power-source) for a human performance rather than the performance itself.

volledige_subject_lijst: The Church (must think, must live, must consider)
We (depart, get a distorted life, move)
God (has called, is calling, will give)
appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Prophetic Moralism' where the gospel is the motivation for social change rather than the news of a completed rescue.
